definition: to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before

sentences.english: NO13, Could I see your driver's license and registration papers?
sentences.chinese: 我可以看你的駕照和行照嗎？

sentences.english: Great, because I'm applying for my driver's license
sentences.chinese: 太好了，因爲我在申請駕照。

sentences.english: My roommate congratulated me on passing the driving test.
sentences.chinese: 我的室友祝賀我通過了駕照考試。

sentences.english: I wonder how he got his driver’s license.
sentences.chinese: 我懷疑他是怎麼考到駕照的。

sentences.english: The front-desk personnel asks the guest for a driver's license and form of payment.
sentences.chinese: 前臺服務員請顧客出示駕照並詢問其付款方式。

sentences.english: The delay is caused by the extra security features built into the new driving licence.
sentences.chinese: 延誤是由向新駕照裏增加額外安全特性而引起的。

sentences.english: The officer examines the license quizzically.
sentences.chinese: 警官迷惑萬分地檢查着駕照。

sentences.english: During Mark's driver examination, his car was hit by a drunk driver.
sentences.chinese: 馬克考駕照時，有人醉酒駕駛撞到他的車。

sentences.english: Cops here immediately confiscate our license and impound our vehicle too on the spot.
sentences.chinese: 警察當場就沒收了我們的駕照，扣押了我們的汽車。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, it is also one of the most difficult to manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這種駕照也是最難製造的證件之一。

sentences.english: Next, you need to replace whatever you lost , your driver's license, things like that.
sentences.chinese: 接下來妳要重辦遺失的證件，像是駕照之類的東西。

sentences.english: NO02,3. I need to see a driver's license or passport, please.
sentences.chinese: 麻煩您，我需要看一下您的駕照或護照。

sentences.english: IT 's rare to find an American teenager wIT hout one.
sentences.chinese: 在美國要找到一個沒有駕照的青少年是很不容易的。
我搞砸了我的駕照考試。

sentences.english: Minimum rental age is 23 years, holding a valid driver license for over 1 year.
sentences.chinese: 租賃人必須爲23歲以上，擁有國際駕照滿一年者。

sentences.english: He decided to take her to school and try this again another day.
sentences.chinese: 他決定把女兒先送回學校，改天再來考駕照。

definition: a pass (authority to enter)/a laissez-passer or safe conduct
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]
to go abroad/to leave the country/emigration
to cross a barrier/to get through (an ordeal)/to pass (a test)/to reach (a standard)
permanent residency permit (originally referred specifically to the US green card)
identity card/also written 身份證|身份证[shen1 fen4 zheng4]
